00022 /*
00023  * Copyright (c) 2007, 2010, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
00024  * Use is subject to license terms.
00025  *
00026  * Copyright (c) 2011, 2014, Intel Corporation.
00027  *
00028  * Copyright 2015 Cray Inc, all rights reserved.
00029  * Author: Ben Evans.
00030  *
00031  * We assume all nodes are either little-endian or big-endian, and we
00032  * always send messages in the sender's native format.  The receiver
00033  * detects the message format by checking the 'magic' field of the message
00034  * (see lustre_msg_swabbed() below).
00035  *
00036  * Each type has corresponding 'lustre_swab_xxxtypexxx()' routines
00037  * are implemented in ptlrpc/pack_generic.c.  These 'swabbers' convert the
00038  * type from "other" endian, in-place in the message buffer.
00039  *
00040  * A swabber takes a single pointer argument.  The caller must already have
00041  * verified that the length of the message buffer >= sizeof (type).
00042  *
00043  * For variable length types, a second 'lustre_swab_v_xxxtypexxx()' routine
00044  * may be defined that swabs just the variable part, after the caller has
00045  * verified that the message buffer is large enough.
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef _LLOG_SWAB_H_
00049 #define _LLOG_SWAB_H_
00050 
00051 #include <lustre/lustre_idl.h>
00052 struct lustre_cfg;
00053 
00054 void lustre_swab_lu_fid(struct lu_fid *fid);
00055 void lustre_swab_ost_id(struct ost_id *oid);
00056 void lustre_swab_ll_fid(struct ll_fid *fid);
00057 void lustre_swab_llogd_body(struct llogd_body *d);
00058 void lustre_swab_llog_hdr(struct llog_log_hdr *h);
00059 void lustre_swab_llogd_conn_body(struct llogd_conn_body *d);
00060 void lustre_swab_llog_rec(struct llog_rec_hdr *rec);
00061 void lustre_swab_llog_id(struct llog_logid *lid);
00062 void lustre_swab_lu_seq_range(struct lu_seq_range *range);
00063 void lustre_swab_update_ops(struct update_ops *uops, unsigned int op_count);
00064 void lustre_swab_lustre_cfg(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg);
00065 void lustre_swab_cfg_marker(struct cfg_marker *marker,
00066                             int swab, int size);

00068 #endif
